articles.title: Could a Brain Pathobiome Be The Hidden Culprit in Alzheimer's Development? - Neuroscience News
articles.description: New research points to the possibility that the development of a pathobiome in the brain could play a role in Alzheimer's and related dementias.
articles.content:
Summary: New research points to the possibility that the development of a pathobiome in the brain could play a role in Alzheimer’s and related dementias.

articles.title: AI detects eye disease and risk of Parkinson's from retinal images - Nature.com
articles.description: Researchers have developed a model trained similarly to ChatGPT that can be adapted to evaluate multiple health conditions.

articles.title: Gut bacteria key to fighting colorectal cancer, study suggests - Medical Xpress

articles.title: Reservoirs of SARS-CoV-2 and their potential role in Long COVID - WSWS
articles.description: There is considerable evidence that the undetected presence of SARS-CoV-2 causes many of the health problems, some severe, described in the term “Long COVID."
articles.content: A review article in Nature Immunology summarizes what is currently known about the persistence of SARS-CoV-2 virus in the body after COVID-19. Theorized as a possible cause of Long COVID, the ongoing… [+8559 chars]
